svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - March 16 2024
March 16 2024

title: "Week in Ethereum News
March 16, 2024" date: "2024-03-16"
Eth News and Links
Dencun (Cancun + Deneb) upgrade (meta EIP7569 )
‚Ä¢ Mainnet successfully upgraded to Dencun Consensus-specs v1.4.0 for Dencun mainnet release
Mainnet successfully upgraded to Dencun
‚Ä¢ Consensus-specs v1.4.0 for Dencun mainnet release
‚Ä¢ EIP4844 (blobs) Layer 2: L2 fees drop to cents & below: L2 Fees , Gas Fees & grow the pie L2s using blobs: zkSync Era , Starknet ,
Optimism & Base , Zora, Mode , Arbitrum and Paradex L2Beat data availability dashboard Dune blob dashboards: Hildobby and 0xRob View blobs
on Blobscan & Etherscan Finematics EIP4844 explainer Reminder: write a data blog post for EF EIP4844 data challenge

Pectra (Prague + Electra) upgrade (meta EIP7600 )
‚Ä¢ Latest all core devs ‚Äì execution (ACDE) call video . Notes from Tim Beiko and Christine Kim : Pectra upgrade (small fork targeting late
2024) EIP2537 BLS : discussions on adding decompress precompiles & exposing operations Potential EIP discussions (but no decisions yet on
what else to include): EIP3074 AUTH/AUTHCALL opcodes : Dan Finlay (MetaMask) case for EIP7547 inclusion lists : breakout call Monday
EIP7623 increase CALLDATA cost : analysis , need feedback from L2s EIP7645 alias ORIGIN to SENDER : alternatively raise price
Latest all core devs ‚Äì execution (ACDE) call video . Notes from Tim Beiko and Christine Kim :
‚Ä¢ Pectra upgrade (small fork targeting late 2024) EIP2537 BLS : discussions on adding decompress precompiles & exposing operations
Potential EIP discussions (but no decisions yet on what else to include): EIP3074 AUTH/AUTHCALL opcodes : Dan Finlay (MetaMask) case for
EIP7547 inclusion lists : breakout call Monday EIP7623 increase CALLDATA cost : analysis , need feedback from L2s EIP7645 alias ORIGIN to
SENDER : alternatively raise price
‚Ä¢ EIP2537 BLS : discussions on adding decompress precompiles & exposing operations
EIP2537 BLS : discussions on adding decompress precompiles & exposing operations
‚Ä¢ Potential EIP discussions (but no decisions yet on what else to include): EIP3074 AUTH/AUTHCALL opcodes : Dan Finlay (MetaMask) case for
Potential EIP discussions (but no decisions yet on what else to include):
‚Ä¢ EIP3074 AUTH/AUTHCALL opcodes : Dan Finlay (MetaMask) case for

This newsletter is sponsored by Pashov Audit Group !
Are you developing a blockchain protocol? Make sure to get a high-quality audit. Audits are not silver bullets, but a good one drastically
decreases the chances of a successful attack. An ‚Äúinternal review‚Äù by your developers is not an audit. Without a formal one many users
won‚Äôt trust your protocol because you are putting their funds at risk.
In Pashov Audit Group we know for a fact that we can help you secure your code in a painless, high-quality and express manner. We are
looking for established projects who invest in security and are looking for the highest quality security partner.
We still have a couple of slots available over the next couple of months. Reach out for security help - pashov.net
Osaka + F starname upgrade (meta EIP7607 )
‚Ä¢ Verkle implementers call video & notes : Kaustinen-5 testnet soon DoS vector means clients need to handle trie depth of 14-16
‚Ä¢ Kaustinen-5 testnet soon
Kaustinen-5 testnet soon
‚Ä¢ DoS vector means clients need to handle trie depth of 14-16
DoS vector means clients need to handle trie depth of 14-16
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
‚Ä¢ üö® Lido at 30.81% is far too close to 33.3% threshold
üö® Lido at 30.81% is far too close to 33.3% threshold
‚Ä¢ Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth 72% supermajority, could cause a chain split Consensus layer: Prysm
38% , any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality Prysm bug found on Goerli testnet highlights need for client diversity
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
‚Ä¢ Execution layer: Geth 72% supermajority, could cause a chain split
Execution layer: Geth 72% supermajority, could cause a chain split
‚Ä¢ Consensus layer: Prysm 38% , any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
Consensus layer: Prysm 38% , any client bug over 33.3% could mean loss of finality
‚Ä¢ Prysm bug found on Goerli testnet highlights need for client diversity
Prysm bug found on Goerli testnet highlights need for client diversity
‚Ä¢ Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America & Europe
Better geographic diversity is optimal , particularly outside of North America & Europe

Stuff for developers
‚Ä¢ Solidity v0.8.25 : Cancun default EVM version, MCOPY used in code generator and TSTORE usage warnings reduced to once per compilation
Solidity v0.8.25 : Cancun default EVM version, MCOPY used in code generator and TSTORE usage warnings reduced to once per compilation
‚Ä¢ Remix v0.45.0 : pin deployed contracts, VM state is saved and fetch code for Blockscout verified contracts
Remix v0.45.0 : pin deployed contracts, VM state is saved and fetch code for Blockscout verified contracts
‚Ä¢ Hardhat v2.22.1 : Hardhat Ignition default deployment system; v2.22.0 : Cancun default EVM version for Hardhat Network
Hardhat v2.22.1 : Hardhat Ignition default deployment system; v2.22.0 : Cancun default EVM version for Hardhat Network
‚Ä¢ Ethernaut-cli (tool box): AI (requires OpenAI API key), utils, Hardhat tasks and Ethernaut challenges; alpha
Ethernaut-cli (tool box): AI (requires OpenAI API key), utils, Hardhat tasks and Ethernaut challenges; alpha
‚Ä¢ Foundry: Forge-std v1.8.0 : uses native assertions, supports packed variables, adds TOML read/write cheatcodes, native string
manipulation cheatcodes and implements interfaces in mock tokens Tip: console.log to debug a deployed contract using vm.etch on a fork
Foundry:
‚Ä¢ Forge-std v1.8.0 : uses native assertions, supports packed variables, adds TOML read/write cheatcodes, native string manipulation
cheatcodes and implements interfaces in mock tokens
